documents.data:
# How to Log In to the Arivix System

Welcome to Arivix, your intelligent assistant platform for automating workflows, booking appointments, and integrating AI-powered agents into your systems. This guide walks you through the step-by-step process to successfully log in to the Arivix system using either a web browser or a mobile device.

---

## üîê Step 1: Navigate to the Login Page

Open your preferred browser and go to the official Arivix login URL:

üëâ [https://app.arivix.ai/login](https://app.arivix.ai/login)

If you are using a custom enterprise domain (e.g., yourcompany.arivix.ai), make sure to visit the correct subdomain as provided by your admin.


---

## üßë‍üíº Step 2: Enter Your Credentials

Once on the login screen, you will see two fields:

- *Email Address: Enter the email associated with your Arivix account.
- **Password*: Type your password carefully. Arivix uses strong encryption for user protection, but incorrect attempts may lead to lockouts.

> üí° Tip: Use a password manager to auto-fill your credentials if you forget them.

---

## üîÅ Step 3: Use SSO or Social Login (Optional)

If your organization has enabled Single Sign-On (SSO) using Google, Microsoft, or other identity providers, you will see buttons like:

- Sign in with Google
- Sign in with Microsoft
- Continue with SSO

Click the appropriate option and follow the OAuth2 flow to log in securely.

> üì¢ Note: If you don't see these options, your organization may not have enabled SSO.

---

## üõ° Step 4: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

If 2FA is enabled on your account, you'll be prompted to enter a verification code sent via:

- *Email
- **SMS
- **Authenticator App* (e.g., Google Authenticator, Authy)

Once the 6-digit code is entered, click Verify to proceed.

> üîê Don't share your 2FA code with anyone‚Äîeven Arivix support.

---

## üíª Step 5: Dashboard Access

After successful login, you'll be redirected to the Arivix Dashboard. This is your control center where you can:

- View and manage AI Agents
- Configure tool integrations (e.g., Slack, Notion, Google Calendar)
- Monitor logs and analytics
- Access Knowledge Bases and Workspaces
- Invite other users or manage your organization settings

> üìä Your role (Super Admin, Admin, or Contributor) will determine which modules you can access.

---

## ‚ùì Troubleshooting Login Issues

Here are some common login problems and how to resolve them:

| Issue                        | Solution                                                                 |
|-----------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Forgot Password             | Click on Forgot Password on the login page and follow the reset steps.|
| Email not recognized        | Ensure you're using the correct email or contact your workspace admin.  |
| 2FA code not received       | Check spam folders or use a backup method if available.                 |
| Account Locked              | Too many failed attempts? Wait 15 minutes or reach out to support.     |

---

## üÜò Need Help?

If you're still unable to access your account, contact Arivix Support:

- *Email: support@arivix.ai
- **Live Chat: Available on [https://arivix.ai](https://arivix.ai)
- **Help Center: [https://docs.arivix.ai](https://docs.arivix.ai)

> ‚úÖ You're now ready to log in and start building your own intelligent agents with Arivix.

---

## üìÑ Related Articles

- [Creating Your First Agent](https://docs.arivix.ai/create-agent)
- [Using the Arivix Dashboard](https://docs.arivix.ai/dashboard-overview)
- [Setting Up Google Calendar Integration](https://docs.arivix.ai/integrations/google-calendar)

---

*Last Updated: July 30, 2025
documents.name: How to Login to Arivix System

documents.data:
# Creating Your First AI Agent in Arivix

Welcome to Arivix! This guide will help you create your first AI agent to automate tasks, handle customer inquiries, or streamline your workflows.

---

## üöÄ Step 1: Access the Agent Builder

After logging in, navigate to the Agents section from the main dashboard and click "Create New Agent."

üëâ [https://app.arivix.ai/agents/new](https://app.arivix.ai/agents/new)

---

## üß† Step 2: Define Your Agent's Purpose

Give your agent a clear name and description that explains its primary function:

- *Agent Name: Customer Support Bot
- **Description*: Handles common customer inquiries and provides product information

> üí° Tip: Be specific about what tasks your agent will perform

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Step 3: Configure Capabilities

Select the capabilities your agent will need:

- Natural Language Processing
- Web Search Integration
- Calendar Access
- File Management
- API Connections

Choose only the capabilities your agent actually needs to function properly.

---

## üéØ Step 4: Set Up Response Templates

Create templates for common responses your agent will provide:

```json
{
  "greeting": "Hello! How can I help you today?",
  "farewell": "Thank you for chatting. Have a great day!",
  "fallback": "I'm not sure how to help with that. Let me connect you with a human agent."
}
```

---

## üîß Step 5: Test Your Agent

Use the testing interface to ensure your agent responds correctly to various inputs before deploying.

> ‚úÖ Your first AI agent is now ready to assist users and automate tasks!

---

*Last Updated: August 1, 2025*
documents.name: Creating Your First AI Agent

documents.data:
# Integrating Arivix with Google Calendar

Learn how to connect your Google Calendar with Arivix to enable scheduling capabilities for your AI agents.

---

## üìÖ Step 1: Navigate to Integrations

From your dashboard, go to Settings ‚Üí Integrations ‚Üí Google Calendar

üëâ [https://app.arivix.ai/integrations/calendar](https://app.arivix.ai/integrations/calendar)

---

## üîó Step 2: Authenticate with Google

Click "Connect Google Account" and follow the OAuth2 authentication process:

- Grant necessary permissions
- Select the calendar you want to integrate
- Confirm the connection

> üîê Arivix only requests read/write permissions for the calendars you select

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Step 3: Configure Calendar Settings

Set up how your agent should interact with your calendar:

- *Default meeting duration: 30 minutes
- **Working hours*: 9AM-5PM, Monday-Friday
- *Buffer time between meetings: 15 minutes
- **Available meeting types*: Consultation, Demo, Support

---

## üß™ Step 4: Test the Integration

Create a test meeting through your agent to ensure the integration works correctly:

```javascript
// Sample meeting creation
const meeting = {
  title: "Test Meeting",
  duration: 30,
  attendees: ["test@example.com"],
  description: "Test meeting created via Arivix integration"
};
```

---

## üöÄ Step 5: Use in Your Agents

Your AI agents can now:

- Check availability
- Schedule meetings
- Send calendar invitations
- Handle rescheduling requests
- Set up reminder notifications

---

## ‚ùì Troubleshooting

Common integration issues:

- Ensure you're logged into the correct Google account
- Check that you've granted all necessary permissions
- Verify your calendar is set to public if scheduling with external users

---

*Last Updated: August 1, 2025*
documents.name: Google Calendar Integration Guide
